quest_name: Dear <Ranger>! We have received information saying

history.location_text: Dear Ranger! We have received information saying that there is a secret base of the famous Peleng Lyakusha named Borzukhan on the uninhabited planet of Bonnasis in Procyon system. Right now we are planning an operation to find and destroy that base, but we need a sufficiently experienced fighter to accomplish this mission. If you agree, you will have to go to the planet of Bonnasis within 35 days. We already have a camp deployed on the planet, where our agents who will brief you on the mission will meet you. You shouldn't have any problems finding the camp; there's a radio beacon nearby. Your fee for this mission will round up to 65535 cr.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
In the camp you were met by the agent of planet Earth.
- Dear Ranger, I am glad to meet you here at the planet of Bonnasis. My name is Carl. As you have probably been told already, your objective here is to locate and destroy a secret Peleng base, known as Lyakusha Borzukhan. The main thing is to destroy the base. At that you will most likely encounter resistance form Borzuklhan himself. If that is the case, you have the full responsibility of what to do, but it would be better if you mange to take the Peleng alive. If you manage to do that we will pay you an extra 1000 cr as a bonus. If you have any questions ask now and I will try to tell you everything I know myself.
choices: Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
How do I destroy the base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’re at the briefing stage with Carl, fully healthy and with limited funds. The mission priority is locating and destroying the secret Peleng base; capturing Borzukhan alive is optional but gives a bonus, so we should plan for it but not at the cost of dying or failing the sabotage. Right now the biggest uncertainty is *where* the base is and what routes/landmarks to use—getting that wrong wastes time and can funnel us into dead-end paths (a prior lesson was that some routes loop or dead-end). The best immediate move is to extract actionable navigation intel: terrain clues, which direction to search, any known entrances, patrol patterns, and what not to do. So I should ask how to find Borzukhan’s base first.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning: We’re at the briefing stage with Carl, fully healthy and with limited funds. The mission priority is locating and destroying the secret Peleng base; capturing Borzukhan alive is optional but gives a bonus, so we should plan for it but not at the cost of dying or failing the sabotage. Right now the biggest uncertainty is *where* the base is and what routes/landmarks to use—getting that wrong wastes time and can funnel us into dead-end paths (a prior lesson was that some routes loop or dead-end). The best immediate move is to extract actionable navigation intel: terrain clues, which direction to search, any known entrances, patrol patterns, and what not to do. So I should ask how to find Borzukhan’s base first.

history.location_text:
- This may surely become a difficult task, since the planet is rather large. Although I could still advise you on the locations, where, we think, the base is most likely to be found. The three most possible base locations are, in our opinion, the mountains north of our camp, the forest south-west of the camp, or the underground caves, which you can reach via a grotto in the east, by the coast. 
But, in any event, keep your eyes open and your ears pricked, it is quite likely that we do not know everything, so do not let this information misguide you.
choices: How do I destroy the base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We now have three candidate search areas (mountains north, forest southwest, coastal grotto east leading to caves). Prior experience suggests some routes can dead-end/loop, and the “real lead” tended to be the mountain/cave rather than wasting time in misleading terrain—so we’ll keep that in mind when choosing where to go. But before leaving, the most valuable remaining intel is *method*: how the base can be destroyed (reactor sabotage, explosives placement, weak points, access requirements). Knowing the intended destruction mechanism helps us prepare for stealth, minimize loud engagements, and avoid wasting resources. Asking why they didn’t locate it is less actionable for mission success.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: We now have three candidate search areas (mountains north, forest southwest, coastal grotto east leading to caves). Prior experience suggests some routes can dead-end/loop, and the “real lead” tended to be the mountain/cave rather than wasting time in misleading terrain—so we’ll keep that in mind when choosing where to go. Knowing the intended destruction mechanism helps us prepare for stealth, minimize loud engagements, and avoid wasting resources. Asking why they didn’t locate it is less actionable for mission success.

history.location_text: - Of course we are not going to send you there unarmed. You will get a laser gun and several grenades in case you run into armed guards. In addition to that we are going to give you a special explosive device with remote control detonator. You will have to find out what is the base's weakest spot and set the explosives there. But do not forget that the capturing of Lyakusha Borzukhan himself is no less important. As I've already mentioned we'd rather that you take him alive, for which we will pay you a bonus, but if that proves impossible you can kill him. In any event do not let him escape!
choices: How do I find Borzukhan's base?
Why didn't you locate the base yourselves?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve secured the key operational details: we’ll be equipped (laser gun, grenades, and a remote explosive), and the mission expects us to identify the base’s weakest point to plant the device. We also have the likely search zones (mountains north, forest southwest, coastal grotto east to caves). Before committing, the only remaining dialogue option is why they couldn’t locate it themselves—this might reveal crucial constraints (e.g., Peleng counterintelligence, decoys, sensor jamming, patrol patterns, disguised entrances) that could directly inform our approach and help avoid traps or time-wasting routes. Since it’s low risk to ask now and can yield extra intel, it’s the best choice before we say we’re ready.

ACTION: 3
history.reasoning: We’ve secured the key operational details: we’ll be equipped (laser gun, grenades, and a remote explosive), and the mission expects us to identify the base’s weakest point to plant the device. We also have the likely search zones (mountains north, forest southwest, coastal grotto east to caves). Since it’s low risk to ask now and can yield extra intel, it’s the best choice before we say we’re ready.

history.location_text: - Of course, we could have sent our people in advance, so that they located the base, but we do not have any agents who'd be experienced enough to do the job. We fear that an inexperienced trooper could accidentally frighten Borzukhan off. If he learns that we have detected his base, he will surely relocate it somewhere else, quite possibly onto another planet altogether, and we will have to look for him again. I hope you understand how important your mission is. By the way, we have some data about the possible locations of the lyakusha's base. I'll mark those up on your map.
choices: How do I destroy the base?
How do I find Borzukhan's base?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve extracted all critical briefing intel: three likely search areas are marked on our map; we’re being supplied with a laser gun, grenades, and a remote explosive device; the objective is to locate the base, find its weakest point (likely reactor/structural vulnerability) and plant the explosive, while preventing Borzukhan from escaping and preferably capturing him alive for a bonus. Further questioning would just repeat earlier info. The best move now is to deploy, keeping in mind past lessons: prioritize stealth and positional control, avoid loud explosive use early, and expect reinforcements after any noisy action.

ACTION: 1
history.reasoning: We’ve extracted all critical briefing intel: three likely search areas are marked on our map; we’re being supplied with a laser gun, grenades, and a remote explosive device; the objective is to locate the base, find its weakest point (likely reactor/structural vulnerability) and plant the explosive, while preventing Borzukhan from escaping and preferably capturing him alive for a bonus. Further questioning would just repeat earlier info. The best move now is to deploy, keeping in mind past lessons: prioritize stealth and positional control, avoid loud explosive use early, and expect reinforcements after any noisy action.

history.location_text:
- Excellent! But before you start off, you must receive your munitions. You are not going to fight Borzukhan empty-handed, are you? So: you will get an explosive charge to destroy the base itself, a laser gun and several grenades. Unfortunately our arms supply is rather limited, since the pilot who navigated the transport that was supposed to deliver the arms here, turned out to be a Peleng hallucinogen addict and ended up colliding with five asteroids at once. I hope you are not hooked on anything like that, are you?
It's a long distance to walk, so we will give you a light flyer. It is pretty small and sufficiently shielded, so the enemy is not likely to detect you, unless you expose yourself. We will show you a picture of Borzukhan, so that you recognise him. That's it. Be careful and attentive, and good luck!
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You are sitting in a light flyer and contemplate where you should go.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Circle over the camp and look around
Go to the east, to the sea
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We have three marked likely zones (mountains north, forest southwest, sea/grotto east). From prior experience, committing blindly can waste time in misleading routes (the coastal/grotto path especially can loop/dead-end), and loud contact later is deadly—so the best early-game advantage is information. Circling over the camp is a low-risk reconnaissance move: it may reveal visual cues (smoke, unnatural structures, patrol activity, trails) pointing to the correct direction before we commit to a long flight into one region. With the flyer in perfect condition and no current threat, gathering intel first increases our odds of choosing the true lead (likely mountains/caves) without prematurely tipping off Borzukhan.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: We have three marked likely zones (mountains north, forest southwest, sea/grotto east). With the flyer in perfect condition and no current threat, gathering intel first increases our odds of choosing the true lead (likely mountains/caves) without prematurely tipping off Borzukhan.

history.location_text: You circled around the camp. To the north you saw a high range. To the west and south of the camp there was an endless swamp. In the south-west there was a forest. When you turned east you saw the ocean and the rocky coast. "So where do I go from here?" - you thought to yourself. Suddenly in the south, right in the middle of the swamp you noticed a thin trace of smoke
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Go to the east, to the sea
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve now gained new, high-value intel that wasn’t in the original three “most likely” areas: a thin trace of smoke rising from the middle of the swamp to the south. That’s a strong anomaly on an otherwise empty swamp and could indicate an outpost, a concealed entrance, a crashed craft, or activity tied to the base (supply camp, generator exhaust, patrol bivouac). Since the mission is time-sensitive (we don’t want Borzukhan alerted and relocating) and because we’re currently safe with a fully functional flyer, the best play is to investigate this lead first—but carefully. We can approach using the flyer to recon from range/altitude and avoid committing to a fight or noisy engagement. If it’s a decoy or unrelated, we can disengage quickly and still proceed to the mountains/sea/forest afterward with minimal lost time.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: We’ve now gained new, high-value intel that wasn’t in the original three “most likely” areas: a thin trace of smoke rising from the middle of the swamp to the south. That’s a strong anomaly on an otherwise empty swamp and could indicate an outpost, a concealed entrance, a crashed craft, or activity tied to the base (supply camp, generator exhaust, patrol bivouac). Since the mission is time-sensitive (we don’t want Borzukhan alerted and relocating) and because we’re currently safe with a fully functional flyer, the best play is to investigate this lead first—but carefully. We can approach using the flyer to recon from range/altitude and avoid committing to a fight or noisy engagement. If it’s a decoy or unrelated, we can disengage quickly and still proceed to the mountains/sea/forest afterward with minimal lost time.

history.location_text: You followed the smoke and soon beheld a group of creatures gathered around a fire. From this distance you still could not make out who they were or what they were doing.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Land carefully not far from the fire
Fly closer to the fire and shoot from the laser gun
Fly closer to the fire and throw a grenade into the crowd.
Land the flyer by the fire
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve found an unexpected group around a fire in the swamp; we still don’t know if they’re Peleng scouts, locals, or something unrelated. Our mission priority is to locate the base without alarming Borzukhan into relocating, so opening with loud violence (laser fire from the air or, worse, a grenade) repeats the earlier mistake: it broadcasts our presence, risks drawing reinforcements, and can turn a potentially informative encounter into a chaotic firefight. We’re totally healthy, but we only have 10 charges and 2 grenades—resources are limited and should be saved for the base or an unavoidable emergency.

The best approach is controlled reconnaissance: land carefully at a safe distance, keep the flyer as an escape option, and assess who they are and what they’re doing before committing to any action. This preserves stealth, keeps options open (observe, bypass, or engage on favorable terms), and minimizes the chance of tipping off Borzukhan.

ACTION: 1

history.location_text: You carefully landed the flyer not far from the fire, behind a huge rock, where no one could see it. No you could see a group of five very unfriendly looking Pelengs sitting by the fire and discussing something. By their side there lay a Human - motionless. He looks like he's been stunned with a powerful stunner charge.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Shoot the Pelengs from the laser gun
Throw a grenade into the Pelengs
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve achieved a strong stealth position: flyer hidden behind a rock, we’re healthy, and we have limited ammo (10 laser charges) and only 2 grenades that are best saved for emergencies or the base itself. The scene includes 5 Pelengs and a stunned Human—this suggests they may have captured/scouted someone (possibly an agent or a lost trooper) and could be discussing the location of Borzukhan’s base, patrol routes, passwords, or how to transport the prisoner. That information is far more valuable than an immediate firefight.

Attacking now (laser or grenade) is risky and noisy, could alert other patrols, and may cause the Pelengs to scatter—exactly what we want to avoid if we’re trying not to tip off Borzukhan. Flying away abandons a prime intelligence opportunity and leaves a Human captive who might later be used to raise an alarm.

Best move: listen first to extract actionable intel (base direction, entrances, codes, guard numbers). We can decide on a quiet takedown/rescue afterward once we know what we’re dealing with.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning:
We’ve achieved a strong stealth position: flyer hidden behind a rock, we’re healthy, and we have limited ammo (10 laser charges) and only 2 grenades that are best saved for emergencies or the base itself. The scene includes 5 Pelengs and a stunned Human—this suggests they may have captured/scouted someone (possibly an agent or a lost trooper) and could be discussing the location of Borzukhan’s base, patrol routes, passwords, or how to transport the prisoner. Best move: listen first to extract actionable intel (base direction, entrances, codes, guard numbers). We can decide on a quiet takedown/rescue afterward once we know what we’re dealing with.

history.location_text: You pricked up your ears and tried to make out what the Pelengs were talking about. By the fragments of their conversation you understood you were in the right: the bunch gathered by the fire was Borzukhan's pirate squad, hailing back from "business" and intending to deliver the prisoner to the base.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
choices: Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
Throw a grenade into the pirates
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve confirmed these are Borzukhan’s pirates and they’re about to take the stunned Human to the base. That creates a major opportunity: if we learn *when* they leave, *which direction/route* they’ll take, and any details they mention about the base (mountains/forest/coast, entrances, passwords, guard rotations), we can either (a) shadow them at a safe distance to get led straight to the base, or (b) ambush them later at a place of our choosing—without broadcasting our presence.

Engaging now (laser or grenade) is exactly the kind of loud contact that can cause survivors to warn the base and/or make the squad scatter, losing the trail. Flying away wastes the best lead we’ve had so far. Since we’re still concealed and not under time pressure in this exact moment, the optimal step is to keep gathering intelligence until we have enough to act decisively.

ACTION: 1
history.reasoning:
We’ve confirmed these are Borzukhan’s pirates and they’re about to take the stunned Human to the base. That creates a major opportunity: if we learn *when* they leave, *which direction/route* they’ll take, and any details they mention about the base (mountains/forest/coast, entrances, passwords, guard rotations), we can either (a) shadow them at a safe distance to get led straight to the base, or (b) ambush them later at a place of our choosing—without broadcasting our presence.

history.location_text: You continued listening to the pirate conversation and heard one of them complain about the habit of their boss Borzukhan spend time all by himself in a small cabin somewhere in the woods to the west. The pirate was sure that this habit was not going to do the boss any good, and you couldn't but agree with him, especially considering the fact that this cretin blurted out a bunch of orientation points, knowing which finding the lyakusha's cabin was a piece of cake!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Shoot the pirates from the laser gun
Throw a grenade into the pirates
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve extracted the most valuable thing this encounter could give us: precise orientation points to Borzukhan’s private cabin in the western woods. That’s a rare, high-leverage opportunity because Borzukhan is described as being there alone—meaning we can potentially capture him alive with far less risk than storming the base first, and without triggering a full-base alarm.

The remaining options are all “noisy”: attacking 5 pirates with a laser risks at least one surviving long enough to flee and warn the base (exactly what Earth feared—Borzkhan relocating). A grenade is even worse: very loud, likely to kill the stunned prisoner, and guaranteed to advertise our presence. Also, we only have 2 grenades and should preserve them for emergencies/escape or a critical base weak-point situation.

So the best strategic play is to disengage now, keep our stealth intact, and head straight for the cabin lead. Once Borzukhan is secured (ideally alive), destroying the base becomes much safer and we also prevent him from escaping.

ACTION: 3

We’ve extracted the most valuable thing this encounter could give us: precise orientation points to Borzukhan’s private cabin in the western woods. That’s a rare, high-leverage opportunity because Borzukhan is described as being there alone—meaning we can potentially capture him alive with far less risk than storming the base first, and without triggering a full-base alarm.

That is strategically superior to randomly searching mountains or the sea route because it offers a chance to secure the main target (preferably alive for the bonus) with minimal resistance, before we attempt the higher-risk task of infiltrating and sabotaging the base. Capturing Borzukhan first also reduces the chance he escapes or relocates once the base is threatened. With our flyer intact and full health, the best next move is to head straight to the forest and locate the cabin, maintaining stealth and conserving grenades for emergencies.

history.location_text: You are circling over the woods. From this height you cannot see anything suspicious. Maybe you should descend?
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Land and look for the lyakusha's cabin
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Our key advantage right now is the intel about Borzukhan’s solitary cabin in these woods. From high altitude we can’t spot anything, and if we “fly somewhere else” we effectively throw away the best lead we’ve earned—returning to broad, low-probability searching (mountains/sea) and giving Borzukhan time to move. The mission also prefers capturing him alive; the cabin is the most favorable setting for that (likely fewer guards, controlled engagement). Therefore we should descend, land, and begin a ground search for the cabin, keeping the flyer concealed and staying alert for patrols so we don’t blunder into a noisy fight.

ACTION: 2
history.reasoning: Our key advantage right now is the intel about Borzukhan’s solitary cabin in these woods. From high altitude we can’t spot anything, and if we “fly somewhere else” we effectively throw away the best lead we’ve earned—returning to broad, low-probability searching (mountains/sea) and giving Borzukhan time to move. Therefore we should descend, land, and begin a ground search for the cabin, keeping the flyer concealed and staying alert for patrols so we don’t blunder into a noisy fight.

history.location_text: Remembering the conversation of the pirates that you'd overheard, you decided to find the cabin, which, they claimed, Lyakusha Borzukhan liked to spend his time in. Since you knew all the main orientation points, the task proved to be quite easy. After several minutes of cautious wandering around the forest you stepped onto a meadow, in the middle of which you indeed saw a wooden cabin with glassed windows. Looks like even these days and even among the pirates there are still folks who like living at one with nature!
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Throw a grenade into the window
Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
Sneak up to the cabin and carefully look in the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The cabin is our best chance to secure Borzukhan with minimal risk and ideally take him alive. Right now we don’t even know if he’s inside, alone, armed, or if there are additional pirates nearby. Acting loudly (grenade or kicking the door) repeats the earlier strategic mistake: it creates noise, risks killing Borzukhan (failing the bonus and possibly the “don’t let him escape” condition if he flees in the confusion), and could alert the base if anyone is in radio range. Knocking politely is also risky because it gives him time to grab a weapon, use a back exit, or set an ambush.

The best tactical step is to gather information first while we still have stealth: sneak up and look through a window to confirm presence, numbers, posture, and possible escape routes. Then we can choose a controlled entry/ambush plan that maximizes capture chances and minimizes alarm.

ACTION: 4
history.reasoning:
The cabin is our best chance to secure Borzukhan with minimal risk and ideally take him alive. Right now we don’t even know if he’s inside, alone, armed, or if there are additional pirates nearby. Acting loudly (grenade or kicking the door) repeats the earlier strategic mistake: it creates noise, risks killing Borzukhan (failing the bonus and possibly the “don’t let him escape” condition if he flees in the confusion), and could alert the base if anyone is in radio range. Knocking politely is also risky because it gives him time to grab a weapon, use a back exit, or set an ambush.

The best tactical step is to gather information first while we still have stealth: sneak up and look through a window to confirm presence, numbers, posture, and possible escape routes. Then we can choose a controlled entry/ambush plan that maximizes capture chances and minimizes alarm.

history.location_text: You crawled up to the window and cautiously peeked inside. In the armchair right in the middle of an expensively furnished room sat Lyakusha Borzukhan himself. Apparently he didn't notice you.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Shoot Borzukhan from the laser gun
Carefully move away from the cabin and go back to the flyer
Shoot the stunner through the window
Carefully step away from the window
history.llm_response:
REASONING: We’ve confirmed the key fact: Borzukhan is inside the cabin and hasn’t noticed us. That’s the best possible setup for the “take him alive” objective, and also the safest moment to control the encounter on our terms. Shooting him now (1) guarantees we lose the live-capture bonus and may create noise that alerts nearby patrols or the base (and if he has any alarm/radio setup, even a brief shot could escalate things). Going all the way back to the flyer (2) throws away this perfect advantage and risks losing him if he leaves the cabin.

The correct next step is to break contact quietly without committing to lethal force—step away from the window (4) so we can choose a better capture approach (controlled entry, positioning to cover exits, and minimizing noise). Keeping stealth for the next move maximizes our chance to capture him alive and prevent escape.

ACTION: 4
history.reasoning:
We’ve confirmed the key fact: Borzukhan is inside the cabin and hasn’t noticed us. That’s the best possible setup for the “take him alive” objective, and also the safest moment to control the encounter on our terms. Keeping stealth for the next move maximizes our chance to capture him alive and prevent escape.

history.location_text: You went back to the forest cabin.
params: You've got a laser gun with 10 charges
You know about the cabin in the forest
choices: Throw a grenade into the window
Kick the door in and burst into the house with your gun ready
Walk up to the cabin and knock politely
history.llm_response:
REASONING: Borzukhan is confirmed inside and unaware (from our window peek earlier). Our priority is to prevent his escape and ideally take him alive for the bonus; also we must avoid loud, indiscriminate actions that could kill him or trigger a broader alarm.

Option 1 (grenade) is the worst: high chance of killing Borzukhan and/or destroying evidence, plus it’s extremely loud and wastes scarce grenades. Option 2 (back to flyer) risks losing the best moment—he could leave the cabin, and we’d be back to searching. Option 4 (knock politely) gives him time to grab a weapon, set an ambush, or slip out a back exit.
